property.name: desc
property.value: In list of configured time period types

property.value: In list of configured available course numbers

property.name: desc
property.value: Sets a field to the currently authenticated user

property.name: comments
property.value: How do we know who the real user is when a service calls another service?

property.name: desc
property.value: Same value as the value of the course.official.numberPart field

property.name: comments
property.value: Not sure how to implement this copy operation or invoke it every time the official course no gets updated

property.name: desc
property.value: Same value as the value of the course.official.subjectArea field

property.value: Not sure how to implement this copy operation or invoke it every time the official course no gets updated

property.name: desc
property.value: Calculates the version indicator that is used for optimistic locking

property.name: comments
property.value: This could be as simple as a nano-second date-time stamp of the last update or a sequence number of the object that gets incremented on each update or some other more complex computation.

property.name: desc
property.value: Sets a field to the current time

property.name: desc
property.value: uppercase alphanumeric code, hypen and period.

property.value: In a list of configured course proposal types

property.name: desc
property.value: Defaults to the currently authenticated user

property.value: How do we know who the real user is when a service calls another service?

property.value: Hidden isn't really a constraint but is captured here to help people think aobut the data and eventualy to help feed the configurable UI.

property.name: desc
property.value: Kuali ID; calculated by service on add, then read-only.

property.name: comments
property.value: MinOccur on ID's of 1 may not work because it is missing on the create

property.name: comments
property.value: MinOccur on Meta data structures may not 1 not work because it is not supplied on the create

property.name: comments
property.value: Read-only isn't really a constraint on the data but is a constraint on the UI. It is here so it can be easily flagged as an attribute so thait can eventually feed the UI.

property.name: comments
property.value: Not sure if characterset for rich text is the same for regular text but just interpretted differently. I.e. html is plain text interpreted differently.
